verses.plain: Now it came to pass after the death of Saul, when David was returned from the slaughter of the Amalekites, and David had abode two days in Ziklag;

tokens.t: Now it came to pass after the death of Saul, when David was returned from the slaughter of the Amalekites, and David had abode two days in Ziklag;

verses.plain: It came even to pass on the third day, that, behold, a man came out of the camp from Saul with his clothes rent, and earth upon his head: and so it was, when he came to David, that he fell to the earth, and did obeisance.

tokens.t: It came even to pass on the third day, that, behold, a man came out of the camp from Saul with his clothes rent, and earth upon his head: and
it was, when he came to David, that he fell to the earth, and did obeisance.

verses.plain: And David said unto him, From whence comest thou? And he said unto him, Out of the camp of Israel am I escaped.

tokens.t: And David said unto him, From whence comest thou? And he said unto him, Out of the camp of Israel am I escaped.

verses.plain: And David said unto him, How went the matter? I pray thee, tell me. And he answered, That the people are fled from the battle, and many of the people also are fallen and dead; and Saul and Jonathan his son are dead also.

tokens.t: And David said unto him, How went the matter? I pray thee, tell me. And he answered, That the people are fled from the battle, and many of the people also are fallen and dead; and Saul and Jonathan his son are dead also.

verses.plain: And David said unto the young man that told him, How knowest thou that Saul and Jonathan his son be dead?

tokens.t: And David said unto the young man that told him, How knowest thou that Saul and Jonathan his son be dead?

verses.plain: And the young man that told him said, As I happened by chance upon mount Gilboa, behold, Saul leaned upon his spear; and, lo, the chariots and horsemen followed hard after him.

tokens.t: And the young man that told him said, As I happened by chance upon mount Gilboa, behold, Saul leaned upon his spear; and, lo, the chariots and horsemen followed hard after him.

verses.plain: And when he looked behind him, he saw me, and called unto me. And I answered, Here am I.

tokens.t: And when he looked behind him, he saw me, and called unto me. And I answered, Here
I.

verses.plain: And he said unto me, Who art thou? And I answered him, I am an Amalekite.

tokens.t: And he said unto me, Who
thou? And I answered him, I
an Amalekite.

verses.plain: He said unto me again, Stand, I pray thee, upon me, and slay me: for anguish is come upon me, because my life is yet whole in me.

tokens.t: He said unto me again, Stand, I pray thee, upon me, and slay me: for anguish is come upon me, because my life
yet whole in me.

verses.plain: So I stood upon him, and slew him, because I was sure that he could not live after that he was fallen: and I took the crown that was upon his head, and the bracelet that was on his arm, and have brought them hither unto my lord.

tokens.t: So I stood upon him, and slew him, because I was sure that he could not live after that he was fallen: and I took the crown that
upon his head, and the bracelet that
on his arm, and have brought them hither unto my lord.

verses.plain: Then David took hold on his clothes, and rent them; and likewise all the men that were with him:

tokens.t: Then David took hold on his clothes, and rent them; and likewise all the men that
with him:

verses.plain: And they mourned, and wept, and fasted until even, for Saul, and for Jonathan his son, and for the people of the LORD, and for the house of Israel; because they were fallen by the sword.

tokens.t: And they mourned, and wept, and fasted until even, for Saul, and for Jonathan his son, and for the people of the
, and for the house of Israel; because they were fallen by the sword.

verses.plain: ¶ And David said unto the young man that told him, Whence art thou? And he answered, I am the son of a stranger, an Amalekite.

tokens.t: ¶ And David said unto the young man that told him, Whence
thou? And he answered, I
the son of a stranger, an Amalekite.

verses.plain: And David said unto him, How wast thou not afraid to stretch forth thine hand to destroy the LORD’s anointed?

tokens.t: And David said unto him, How wast thou not afraid to stretch forth thine hand to destroy the
anointed?

verses.plain: And David called one of the young men, and said, Go near, and fall upon him. And he smote him that he died.

tokens.t: And David called one of the young men, and said, Go near,
fall upon him. And he smote him that he died.

verses.plain: And David said unto him, Thy blood be upon thy head; for thy mouth hath testified against thee, saying, I have slain the LORD’s anointed.

tokens.t: And David said unto him, Thy blood
upon thy head; for thy mouth hath testified against thee, saying, I have slain the
anointed.

verses.plain: ¶ And David lamented with this lamentation over Saul and over Jonathan his son:

tokens.t: ¶ And David lamented with this lamentation over Saul and over Jonathan his son:

verses.plain: (Also he bade them teach the children of Judah the use of the bow: behold, it is written in the book of Jasher.)

tokens.t: (Also he bade them teach the children of Judah
the bow: behold,
written in the book of Jasher.)

verses.plain: The beauty of Israel is slain upon thy high places: how are the mighty fallen!

tokens.t: The beauty of Israel is slain upon thy high places: how are the mighty fallen!

verses.plain: Tell it not in Gath, publish it not in the streets of Askelon; lest the daughters of the Philistines rejoice, lest the daughters of the uncircumcised triumph.

tokens.t: Tell
not in Gath, publish
not in the streets of Askelon; lest the daughters of the Philistines rejoice, lest the daughters of the uncircumcised triumph.

verses.plain: Ye mountains of Gilboa, let there be no dew, neither let there be rain, upon you, nor fields of offerings: for there the shield of the mighty is vilely cast away, the shield of Saul, as though he had not been anointed with oil.

tokens.t: Ye mountains of Gilboa,
no dew, neither
rain, upon you, nor fields of offerings: for there the shield of the mighty is vilely cast away, the shield of Saul,
not
anointed with oil.

verses.plain: From the blood of the slain, from the fat of the mighty, the bow of Jonathan turned not back, and the sword of Saul returned not empty.

tokens.t: From the blood of the slain, from the fat of the mighty, the bow of Jonathan turned not back, and the sword of Saul returned not empty.

verses.plain: Saul and Jonathan were lovely and pleasant in their lives, and in their death they were not divided: they were swifter than eagles, they were stronger than lions.

tokens.t: Saul and Jonathan
lovely and pleasant in their lives, and in their death they were not divided: they were swifter than eagles, they were stronger than lions.

verses.plain: Ye daughters of Israel, weep over Saul, who clothed you in scarlet, with other delights, who put on ornaments of gold upon your apparel.

tokens.t: Ye daughters of Israel, weep over Saul, who clothed you in scarlet, with
delights, who put on ornaments of gold upon your apparel.

verses.plain: How are the mighty fallen in the midst of the battle! O Jonathan, thou wast slain in thine high places.

tokens.t: How are the mighty fallen in the midst of the battle! O Jonathan,
slain in thine high places.

verses.plain: I am distressed for thee, my brother Jonathan: very pleasant hast thou been unto me: thy love to me was wonderful, passing the love of women.

tokens.t: I am distressed for thee, my brother Jonathan: very pleasant hast thou been unto me: thy love to me was wonderful, passing the love of women.

verses.plain: How are the mighty fallen, and the weapons of war perished!

tokens.t: How are the mighty fallen, and the weapons of war perished!

footnotes.text: anguish…: or, my coat of mail (or, my embroidered coat) hindereth me, that my, etc
of Jasher: or, of the upright
